member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.UseZip64
member.summary: Determines how entries are tested to see if they should use Zip64 extensions or not.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.UseZip64.Off
member.summary: Zip64 will not be forced on entries during processing.
member.remarks: An entry can have this overridden if required

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.UseZip64.On
member.summary: Zip64 should always be used.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.UseZip64.Dynamic
member.summary: #ZipLib will determine use based on entry values when added to archive.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod
member.summary: The kind of compression used for an entry in an archive

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod.Stored
member.summary: A direct copy of the file contents is held in the archive

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod.Deflated
member.summary: Common Zip compression method using a sliding dictionary of up to 32KB and secondary compression from Huffman/Shannon-Fano trees

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod.Deflate64
member.summary: An extension to deflate with a 64KB window. Not supported by #Zip currently

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod.BZip2
member.summary: BZip2 compression. Not supported by #Zip.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod.WinZipAES
member.summary: WinZip special for AES encryption, Now supported by #Zip.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags
member.summary: Defines the contents of the general bit flags field for an archive entry.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Encrypted
member.summary: Bit 0 if set indicates that the file is encrypted

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Method
member.summary: Bits 1 and 2 - Two bits defining the compression method (only for Method 6 Imploding and 8,9 Deflating)

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Descriptor
member.summary: Bit 3 if set indicates a trailing data desciptor is appended to the entry data

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPKware4
member.summary: Bit 4 is reserved for use with method 8 for enhanced deflation

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Patched
member.summary: Bit 5 if set indicates the file contains Pkzip compressed patched data. Requires version 2.7 or greater.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.StrongEncryption
member.summary: Bit 6 if set indicates strong encryption has been used for this entry.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused7
member.summary: Bit 7 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused8
member.summary: Bit 8 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused9
member.summary: Bit 9 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused10
member.summary: Bit 10 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.UnicodeText
member.summary: Bit 11 if set indicates the filename and comment fields for this file must be encoded using UTF-8.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.EnhancedCompress
member.summary: Bit 12 is documented as being reserved by PKware for enhanced compression.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.HeaderMasked
member.summary: Bit 13 if set indicates that values in the local header are masked to hide their actual values, and the central directory is encrypted.
member.remarks: Used when encrypting the central directory contents.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPkware14
member.summary: Bit 14 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPkware15
member.summary: Bit 15 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DataDescriptorSignature
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.EXTSIG
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DefaultCodePage
member.summary: Default encoding used for string conversion. 0 gives the default system OEM code page. Dont use unicode encodings if you want to be Zip compatible! Using the default code page isnt the full solution neccessarily there are many variable factors, codepage 850 is often a good choice for European users, however be careful about compatability.

member.name: T:CADImport.CADImage
member.summary: Represents a CAD drawing and provides methods for drawing all loaded CAD objects.
member.remarks:
CADImage class is a superstructure on the CADConverter. This is a base class for AutoCAD DXF graphic files objects. CADImage uses GDI+ classes for drawing DXF files. DXF is an acronym for Drawing eXchange Format. DXF is a widely used file format for displaying 2D and 3D CAD data. It's not an open format but owned by AutoDesk Inc. who uses it for their AutoCAD application. With every new version of AutoCAD the definition of DXF is changed but nevertheless there are many programs which are capable to read and write different versions of DXF. DXF is an ASCII replication of the drawing's contents. It enables an interchange of files from AutoCAD to other applications' formats. DXF import/export is supported by a wide variety of applications, ranging from CAD products to word processors, desktop publishing and illustrating tools. The DXF CAD format has become the de facto standard in PC based CAD industry with many other CAD systems able to read and write this format too.
Major features :
CADImage implements quick and exact reading DXF files and manipulating them using GDI+ functions for drawing.
The fastest DXF reader.
3D support including nested extrusions.
Compatible with AutoDesk DXF Release 12, 13, 14 and 2000, 2002, 2004.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipInputStream
member.summary:
This is an InflaterInputStream that reads the files baseInputStream an zip archive one after another. It has a special method to get the zip entry of the next file. The zip entry contains information about the file name size, compressed size, Crc, etc. It includes support for Stored and Deflated entries.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.InflaterInputStream
member.summary:
This filter stream is used to decompress data compressed using the "deflate" format. The "deflate" format is described in RFC 1951.
This stream may form the basis for other decompression filters, such as the GZipInputStream.
Author of the original java version : John Leuner.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater
member.summary:
Inflater is used to decompress data that has been compressed according to the "deflate" standard described in rfc1951.
By default Zlib (rfc1950) headers and footers are expected in the input. You can use constructor public Inflater(bool noHeader) passing true if there is no Zlib header information
The usage is as following. First you have to set some input with SetInput(), then Inflate() it. If inflate doesn't inflate any bytes there may be three reasons:
IsNeedingInput() returns true because the input buffer is empty. You have to provide more input with SetInput(). NOTE: IsNeedingInput() also returns true when, the stream is finished.
IsNeedingDictionary() returns true, you have to provide a preset dictionary with SetDictionary().
IsFinished returns true, the inflater has finished.
Once the first output byte is produced, a dictionary will not be needed at a later stage.
author of the original java version : John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.summary: These are the possible states for an inflater

member.summary: Copy lengths for literal codes 257..285

member.summary: Extra bits for literal codes 257..285

member.summary: Copy offsets for distance codes 0..29

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.CPDEXT
member.summary: Extra bits for distance codes

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.DecodeHeader
member.summary: Decodes a zlib/RFC1950 header.
member.returns: False if more input is needed.

member.summary: Decodes the dictionary checksum after the deflate header.
member.returns: False if more input is needed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.DecodeHuffman
member.summary: Decodes the huffman encoded symbols in the input stream.
member.returns: false if more input is needed, true if output window is full or the current block ends.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.DecodeChksum
member.summary: Decodes the adler checksum after the deflate stream.
member.returns: false if more input is needed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.Decode
member.summary: Decodes the deflated stream.
member.returns: false if more input is needed, or if finished.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the preset dictionary. This should only be called, if needsDictionary() returns true and it should set the same dictionary, that was used for deflating. The getAdler() function returns the checksum of the dictionary needed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the preset dictionary. This should only be called, if needsDictionary() returns true and it should set the same dictionary, that was used for deflating. The getAdler() function returns the checksum of the dictionary needed.
member.param: The index into buffer where the dictionary starts.
The number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.exception: The adler checksum for the buffer is invalid

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.SetInput(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the input. This should only be called, if needsInput() returns true.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the input. This should only be called, if needsInput() returns true.
member.param: The index into buffer where the input starts.
The number of bytes of input to use.
member.exception: The index and/or count are wrong.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.Inflate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Inflates the compressed stream to the output buffer. If this returns 0, you should check, whether IsNeedingDictionary(), IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished() returns true, to determine why no further output is produced.
member.returns: The number of bytes written to the buffer, 0 if no further output can be produced.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.Inflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inflates the compressed stream to the output buffer. If this returns 0, you should check, whether needsDictionary(), needsInput() or finished() returns true, to determine why no further output is produced.
member.param: the offset in buffer where storing starts.
the maximum number of bytes to output.
member.returns: the number of bytes written to the buffer, 0 if no further output can be produced.
member.exception: if the index and / or count are wrong.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Returns true, if the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method also returns true when the stream is finished.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.IsNeedingDictionary
member.summary: Returns true, if a preset dictionary is needed to inflate the input.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Returns true, if the inflater has finished. This means, that no input is needed and no output can be produced.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.Adler
member.summary: Gets the adler checksum. This is either the checksum of all uncompressed bytes returned by inflate(), or if needsDictionary() returns true (and thus no output was yet produced) this is the adler checksum of the expected dictionary.
member.returns: the adler checksum.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.TotalOut
member.summary: Gets the total number of output bytes returned by Inflate().
member.returns: the total number of output bytes.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.TotalIn
member.summary: Gets the total number of processed compressed input bytes.
member.returns: The total number of bytes of processed input bytes.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.RemainingInput
member.summary: Gets the number of unprocessed input bytes. Useful, if the end of the stream is reached and you want to further process the bytes after the deflate stream.
member.returns: The number of bytes of the input which have not been processed.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater
member.summary:
This is the Deflater class. The deflater class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.
This class is not thread safe. This is inherent in the API, due to the split of deflate and setInput.
author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_SPEED
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFLATED
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with default compression level.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION, or DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION.
true, if we should suppress the Zlib/RFC1950 header at the beginning and the adler checksum at the end of the output. This is useful for the GZIP/PKZIP formats.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. This is not part of Sun's JDK so I have made it package private. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement flush().

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. If you call setInput when needsInput() returns false, the previous input that is still pending will be thrown away. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again. This call is equivalent to setInput(input, 0, input.length).
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished() or ended().

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
the number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was Finish()ed or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.GetLevel
member.summary: Get current compression level
member.returns: Returns the current compression level

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetStrategy(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflateStrategy)
member.summary: Sets the compression strategy. Strategy is one of DEFAULT_STRATEGY, HUFFMAN_ONLY and FILTERED. For the exact position where the strategy is changed, the same as for SetLevel() applies.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deflates the current input block with to the given array.
member.param: The buffer where compressed data is stored
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished returns true or length is zero.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either needsInput() or finished() returns true or length is zero.
member.exception: If offset or length don't match the array length.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. This call is equivalent to setDictionary(dict, 0, dict.Length).
member.exception: if SetInput () or Deflate () were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. The dictionary is a byte array containing strings that are likely to occur in the data which should be compressed. The dictionary is not stored in the compressed output, only a checksum. To decompress the output you need to supply the same dictionary again.
member.param: The index where dictionary information commences.
The number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.exception: If SetInput () or Deflate() were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.level
member.summary: Compression level.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.noZlibHeaderOrFooter
member.summary: If true no Zlib/RFC1950 headers or footers are generated

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.state
member.summary: The current state.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.totalOut
member.summary: The total bytes of output written.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.pending
member.summary: The pending output.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.engine
member.summary: The deflater engine.

member.summary: Gets the number of input bytes processed so far.

member.summary: Gets the number of output bytes so far.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Returns true if the stream was finished and no more output bytes are available.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Returns true, if the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method can also return true when the stream was finished.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipOutputStream
member.summary:
This is a DeflaterOutputStream that writes the files into a zip archive one after another. It has a special method to start a new zip entry. The zip entries contains information about the file name size, compressed size, CRC, etc.
It includes support for Stored and Deflated entries. This class is not thread safe.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.DeflaterOutputStream
member.summary:
A special stream deflating or compressing the bytes that are written to it. It uses a Deflater to perform actual deflating.
Authors of the original java version : Tom Tromey, Jochen Hoenicke

member.summary: Creates a new DeflaterOutputStream with a default Deflater and default buffer size.

member.param: the output stream where deflated output should be written.

member.summary: Creates a new DeflaterOutputStream with the given Deflater and buffer size.
member.param: The output stream where deflated output is written.
The buffer size in bytes to use when deflating (minimum value 512)
member.exception: bufsize is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:CADImport.CADConverter.Iterate(CADImport.CADEntityProc,CADImport.CADEntityProc,CADImport.CADIterate)
member.summary: Invokes a method referenced by the specified delegate for each loaded entity.
member.param: A CADEntityProc delegate that specifies a method to be invoked.
A CADEntityProc delegate that specifies a method to be finished
A CADIterate object that provides parameters used for setting the CADConverter before invoking the specified method for each loaded entity.
member.remarks: This method invokes the referenced (by the delegate) method for each existing entity including block references (inserts) of any nesting level. In other words, this method converts CAD tree structure to a linear sequence of entities. It is a basis for different operations such as drawing or importing the CAD files. Before invoking a referenced procedure it is necessary to set the matrix. This matrix changes automatically on entering a block reference and restores when exiting from it. An additional is a user defined parameter. All other CADIterate fields are initialized by the Iterate method.

member.value: true if the text is turned backwards; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When the text line is turned backwards, all letters of the text are also turned backwards.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.HAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets a horizontal alignment of a text.
member.value: A number that identifies a text alignment in reference to the StartPoint.
member.remarks: A horizontal text alignment is specified by the following numbers: 0 - left, 1 - center, 2 - right, 3 - aligned(if vertical alignment = 0), 4 - middle(if vertical alignment = 0), 5 - fit(if vertical alignment = 0).

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets a height of the CADText letters.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.ObliqueAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets a tilt angle for the CADText letters.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets a rotation angle of the CADText object.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.XScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a width scale (width factor) for the CADText.
member.value: More than one if the text letters are stretched; less than one and more than zero if the text letters are squeezed. A modified width is equal to the previous text width multiplied by a width factor.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.StartPoint
member.summary: Gets the start point of the text line.
member.value: A DPoint object representing the start point of the text line.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets a style for the CADText object.
member.value: A CADStyle object that represents a style for the single line text.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets a text contents for the CADText object.
member.value: A string containing a text represented by this CADText object.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.UpsideDown
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the text line is turned downwards (mirrored along axis Z).
member.value: true if the text is turned downwards; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.VAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets a vetical alignment of the text.
member.value: A number that identifies a text alignment in reference to the StartPoint.
member.remarks: A vertical text alignment is specified by the following numbers: 0 - baseline, 1 - bottom, 2 - middle, 3 - top

member.name: P:CADImport.CADText.Point1
member.summary: Gets or sets a second alignment point of the CADText object.
member.value: A DPoint object representing the second alignment point for the CADText.
member.remarks: The return value is meaningful only if the HAlign and VAlign values are nonzero.

member.name: T:CADImport.CADEllipse
member.summary: Represents a full ellipse or elliptical arc in a CAD image.
member.remarks: An ellipse is specified by two perpendicular axes that define its width and length. The longer axis is called the major axis, and the shorter one is the minor axis.

member.name: T:CADImport.CADSpline

member.remarks: A spline is specified by fit points and control points. Fit points are connected by a smooth curve that forms a spline. Control points form a spline as a continuous approximation line that goes proportionally remote from them.

member.name: T:CADImport.CADVertex
member.summary: Represents a vertex of a CADPolyLine.
member.remarks: The vertex is a special point of a polyline. It can specify the start point of a polyline, or its end point, or a junction point of two polyline segments. The vertex also has the index value that specifies an order the vertex appears within the polyline, with the first being numbered 1.

member.name: M:CADImport.CADVertex.AssignEntity(CADImport.CADEntity)
member.summary: Copies an entity

member.name: M:CADImport.CADVertex.SetHandle(System.UInt64)
member.summary: need help

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.Point
member.summary: Gets or sets coordinates of the CADVertex.
member.value: A DPoint object that provides coordinates of the vertex.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.Box
member.summary: Gets a three-dimensional box that encloses the CADVertex entity.
member.value: A DRect object representing the enclosing box for the CADVertex.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.Bulge
member.summary: Gets or sets a bulge for the arc segment starting at this vertex.
member.remarks: The bulge is the tangent of one fourth the included angle for an arc segment, made negative if the arc goes clockwise from the start point to the end point. A bulge of 0 indicates a straight segment, and a bulge of 1 is a semicircle.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.EndWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a width at the end point of a polyline segment that started at this vertex.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets a byte that contains flags for this CADVertex.
member.remarks: Vertex flags: 1 = Extra vertex created by curve-fitting. 2 = Curve-fit tangent defined for this vertex. A curve-fit tangent direction of 0 may be omitted from DXF output but is significant if this bit is set. 4 = Not used. 8 = Spline vertex created by spline-fitting. 16 = Spline frame control point. 32 = 3D polyline vertex. 64 = 3D polygon mesh. 128 = Polyface mesh vertex.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.StartWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a width at the start point of a polyline segment that started at this vertex.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.PolyFaceVertexIndex1
member.summary: Gets or sets an index of this CADVertex when it represents a first vertex specifying a face belonging to the polyface mesh.
member.remarks: Every vertex that is a part of a polyface mesh has its vertex flag 128 bit set.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.PolyFaceVertexIndex2
member.summary: Gets or sets an index of this CADVertex when it represents a second vertex specifying a face belonging to the polyface mesh.
member.remarks: Every vertex that is a part of a polyface mesh has its vertex flag 128 bit set.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.PolyFaceVertexIndex3
member.summary: Gets or sets an index of this CADVertex when it represents a third vertex specifying a face belonging to the polyface mesh.
member.remarks: Every vertex that is a part of a polyface mesh has its vertex flag 128 bit set.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADVertex.PolyFaceVertexIndex4
member.summary: Gets or sets an index of this CADVertex when it represents a fourth vertex specifying a face belonging to the polyface mesh.
member.remarks: Every vertex that is a part of a polyface mesh has its vertex flag 128 bit set.

member.summary: Represents a block in a CAD file.
member.remarks: A CAD block is a collection of related objects that can be treated as a single object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CADBlock class.

member.returns: true if a CADEntity was added; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADBlock.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets a byte that contains flags for this CADBlock.
member.remarks: Block flags:

0 = Indicates none of the following flags apply. 1 = This is an anonymous block generated by hatching, associative dimensioning, other internal operations, or an application. 2 = This block has non-constant attribute definitions (this bit is not set if the block has any attribute definitions that are constant, or has no attribute definitions at all). 4 = This block is an external reference (xref). 8 = This block is an xref overlay. 16 = This block is externally dependent. 32 = This is a resolved external reference, or dependent of an external reference (ignored on input). 64 = This definition is a referenced external reference (ignored on input).

member.name: P:CADImport.CADBlock.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a CADBlock name read from a CAD file.
member.value: A string containing a CADBlock name read from a CAD file.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADLayer.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a CADLayer is visible.
member.value: true if a CADLayer is visible; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If a layer is frozen or invisible the CAD entities it contains will also be invisible. If a layer is invisible but not frozen and it contains inserts of blocks belonging to visible layers then those blocks will be visible.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADLayer.Frozen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a CADLayer is frozen.
member.value: true if a CADLayer is frozen; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If a layer is frozen all CAD entities it contains will be invisible even if it has inserts of blocks belonging to visible layers.

member.summary: Gets or sets a path to a file containing big fonts.
member.value: A string containing a path to a file containing big fonts.
member.remarks: Big font files include glyphs for multiple character sets and accommodate many languages.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.FixedHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a fixed text height.
member.remarks: A fixed text height is an initial text height of all newly added texts defined by this CADStyle. A zero value means that a text height is not fixed and a user will be prompted to enter a height value for a newly added text.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets a font name.
member.value: A string containing a font name.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.LastHeightUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets an initial height of the last added text defined by this CADStyle.
member.remarks: A value returned by this property can coincide with the FixedHeight or be defined at the moment of adding a text to a CAD image.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.ObliqueAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets a tilt angle for letters defined by this CADStyle.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.PrimaryFont
member.summary: Gets or sets a name of the file containing fonts for texts in a CAD image.
member.value: A string representing a name of the file containing fonts for texts in a CAD image.

members.member:
Gets or sets a byte that contains text generation flags.
Text generation flags (bit-coded values): 2 = Text is backward (mirrored in X). 4 = Text is upside down (mirrored in Y)..

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.WidthFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a width factor (width scale) defined by this CADStyle.
member.value: More than one if text letters are stretched; less than one and more than zero if the text letters are squeezed. A modified width is equal to the previous width multiplied by a width factor.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.UpsideDown
member.summary: Defines whether text is upside down (mirrored in Y) or not.

member.name: P:CADImport.CADStyle.Backward
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a text is backward (mirrored in X) or not.

member.name: P:CADImport.CAD2DEllipse.IsAngleInParam
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which type of angle specifies the start and end points of this CAD2DEllipse.
member.value: true if the start and end points are specified by the angle formed by two radiuses of the external circumference; false if the start and end points are specified by the angle formed by two radiuses of the internal circumference.
member.remarks: Each ellipse is specified by two circumferences: internal and external. The internal circumference is incorporated by the ellipse and its diameter coincides with the ellipse's minor axis. The external circumference incorporates the ellipse and its diameter coincides with the ellipse's major axis.

For internal use
Adds the hatch line represented by this sgLines object to the specified point collection. A first endpoint of the hatch line whose points will be added to the collection. member.summary: The default strategy

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflateStrategy.HuffmanOnly
member.summary: This strategy will not look for string repetitions at all. It only encodes with Huffman trees (which means, that more common characters get a smaller encoding.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.FindLongestMatch(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Find the best (longest) string in the window matching the string starting at strstart.
Preconditions:
strstart + MAX_MATCH <= window.length.
member.returns: True if a match greater than the minimum length is found

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.head
member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.prev
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.strstart
member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.window
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: T:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData
member.summary: The DXFData class can contain information about any DXF entity.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.tag
member.summary: Specifies the type of a DXF entity.

remarks.p: DXF_UNKNOWN = 0;
DXF_TABLE = 1;
DXF_BLOCK = 2;
DXF_LTYPE = 3;
DXF_LAYER = 4;
DXF_VERTEX = 5;
DXF_LINE = 6;
DXF_SOLID = 7;
DXF_CIRCLE = 8;
DXF_ARC = 9;
DXF_POLYLINE = 10;
DXF_LWPOLYLINE = 11;
DXF_SPLINE = 12;
DXF_INSERT = 13;
DXF_DIMENSION = 14;
DXF_TEXT = 15;
DXF_MTEXT = 16;
DXF_ATTDEF = 17;
DXF_ELLIPSE = 18;
DXF_POINT = 19;
DXF_3DFACE = 20;

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.count
member.summary: Represents the number of child entities (for BLOCK, POLYLINE etc). For simple entities such as LINE it is always 0.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.flags
member.summary: Represents the flags byte for different entities, such as LAYER, BLOCK, POLYLINE etc. Has individual meaning for each entity type. For details see AutoCAD DXF Reference.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.style
member.summary: Specifies the pen style for drawing of this entity.

remarks.p: PS_SOLID - Pen is solid.
PS_DASH - Pen is dashed.
PS_DOT - Pen is dotted.
PS_DASHDOT - Pen has alternating dashes and dots.
PS_DASHDOTDOT - Pen has dashes and double dots.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.selfType
member.summary: Defines a type of this entity.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.color
member.summary: Represents the color value for this entity.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.thickness
member.summary: Specifies the line width for this entity.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.rotation
member.summary: Specifies the rotation angle in degrees for TEXT or INSERT.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.text
member.summary: Specifies a text value for text entities (TEXT, MTEXT or ATTDEF).

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.point
member.summary: Specifies the reference point for this entity. For details see AutoCAD DXF Reference, group codes 10,20,30.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.point1
member.summary: Specifies the second reference point for such entities as LINE, TEXT or ELLIPSE. For details see AutoCAD DXF Reference, group codes 11,21,31.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.point2
member.summary: Specifies the third points for SOLID and 3DFACE.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.point3
member.summary: Specifies the fourth points for SOLID and 3DFACE.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.radius
member.summary: Specifies the radius value for CIRCLE and ARC or ratio of minor axis to major axis for ELLIPSE.

member.summary: Specifies the start angle values in degrees for ARC and ELLIPSE.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.endAngle
member.summary: Represents the end angle values in degrees for ARC and ELLIPSE.

member.summary: Specifies the X-, Y- and Z-scale values for INSERT.

member.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment for text entities.

member.name: F:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFData.vAlign
member.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment for text entities.
member.remarks: 0 = Baseline; 1 = Bottom; 2 = Middle; 3 = Top.

member.name: P:CADImport.Export.SimpleCADtoDXF.DXFLayer.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets a byte that contains flags for the DXFLayer object.
member.remarks: bit-coded values:

1 = Layer is frozen; otherwise layer is thawed 2 = Layer is frozen by default in new viewports 4 = Layer is locked 16 = If set, table entry is externally dependent on an xref 32 = If both this bit and bit 16 are set, the externally dependent xref has been successfully resolved 64 = If set, the table entry was referenced by at least one entity in the drawing the last time the drawing was edited. (This flag can be ignored by most programs that read DXF files and need not be set by programs that write DXF files)

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Crc32
member.summary:
Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.
Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.
This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.
The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Checksums.IChecksum
member.summary: Interface to compute a data checksum used by checked input/output streams. A data checksum can be updated by one byte or with a byte array. After each update the value of the current checksum can be returned by calling getValue. The complete checksum object can also be reset so it can be used again with new data.

member.summary: Adds one byte to the data checksum.

member.name: T:CADImport.FaceModule.s3DStates
member.summary: Specifies cursors for the 3D Orbit tool.

member.name: F:CADImport.FaceModule.s3DStates.X
member.summary: A cursor looks as a vertical ellipse around a small sphere when it hovers over one of the smaller circles on the top or bottom of the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking and dragging from either of these points rotates the CAD image around the horizontal or X axis that extends through the center of the 3D Orbit tool.

member.name: F:CADImport.FaceModule.s3DStates.Y
member.summary: A cursor looks as a horisontal ellipse around a small sphere when it hovers over one of the smaller circles on the left or right sides of the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking and dragging from either of these points rotates the CAD image around the vertical or Y axis that extends through the center of the 3D Orbit tool.

member.name: F:CADImport.FaceModule.s3DStates.Z
member.summary: A cursor looks as a circular arrow around a small sphere when it moves outside the arcball of the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking outside the arcball and dragging the cursor around the arcball moves the CAD image around the Z axis that extends through the center of the 3D Orbit tool, perpendicular to the screen.

member.name: F:CADImport.FaceModule.s3DStates.XY
member.summary: A cursor looks as a small sphere encircled by two lines when it is positioned over the arcball of the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking inside the arcball and dragging the cursor rotates the CAD image around X axis, or Y axis, or X and Y axes simultaneously depending on the direction the cursor moves.

member.name: T:CADImport.FaceModule.Orbit3D
member.summary: Provides a possibility of drawing's rotation.

remarks.p: A drawing for rotation is set by the CADImage property of the Orbit3D class. When the Visible property is set to true, a 3D Orbit tool is displayed within the active viewport. After that you may rotate the drawing.
Note: Its necessary to set the Parent property that returns a control on which the CAD image is drawn. If a resizing the drawing is necessary call Draw method with new parameters.

Click and drag the cursor to rotate the image. When you move your cursor over different parts of the 3D Orbit tool, the cursor icon changes. When you click to start dragging the appearance of your cursor indicates the rotation of the image as follows:

A small sphere encircled by two lines is the cursor icon displayed when you move the cursor inside the 3D Orbit tool. When the cursor is a sphere you can manipulate the image by clicking and dragging. It works as if your cursor grabs a sphere surrounding the objects and drags the sphere around the target point. You can drag horizontally, vertically, and diagonally.

A circular arrow around a small sphere is the cursor icon displayed when you move the cursor outside the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking outside the 3D Orbit tool and dragging the cursor around it moves the image around an axis that extends through the center of the 3D Orbit tool, perpendicular to the screen. This is called a "roll".

A horizontal ellipse around a small sphere is the cursor icon displayed when you move the cursor over one of the smaller circles on the left or right side of the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking and dragging from either of these points rotates the image around the vertical or Y axis that extends through the center of the 3D Orbit tool. The Y axis is represented by a vertical line on the cursor.

A vertical ellipse around a small sphere is the cursor displayed when you move the cursor over one of the smaller circles on the top or bottom of the 3D Orbit tool. Clicking and dragging from either of these points rotates the image around the horizontal or X axis that extends through the center of the 3D Orbit tool. The X axis is represented by a horizontal line on the cursor .

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipFile
member.summary:
This class represents a Zip archive. You can ask for the contained entries, or get an input stream for a file entry. The entry is automatically decompressed.
You can also update the archive adding or deleting entries.
This class is thread safe for input: You can open input streams for arbitrary entries in different threads.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipFile.UncompressedStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.
The stream does not support reading.

A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry
member.summary:
This class represents an entry in a zip archive. This can be a file or a directory ZipFile and ZipInputStream will give you instances of this class as information about the members in an archive. ZipOutputStream uses an instance of this class when creating an entry in a Zip file.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a zip entry with the given name.
member.param: The name for this entry. Can include directory components. The convention for names is 'unix' style paths with relative names only. There are with no device names and path elements are separated by '/' characters.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a zip entry with the given name and version required to extract
member.param: The name for this entry. Can include directory components. The convention for names is 'unix' style paths with no device names and path elements separated by '/' characters. This is not enforced see CleanName on how to ensure names are valid if this is desired.
The minimum 'feature version' required this entry

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod)
member.summary: Initializes an entry with the given name and made by information
member.param: Minimum required zip feature version required to extract this entry
member.remarks: This constructor is used by the ZipFile class when reading from the central header It is not generally useful, use the constructor specifying the name only.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.CleanName(System.String)
member.summary: Cleans a name making it conform to Zip file conventions. Devices names ('c:\') and UNC share names ('\\server\share') are removed and forward slashes ('\') are converted to back slashes ('/'). Names are made relative by trimming leading slashes which is compatible with the ZIP naming convention.
member.returns: The 'cleaned' name.
member.remarks: The Zip name transform class is more flexible.

member.remarks: This is an assistant that interprets the flags property.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.IsUnicodeText
member.summary: Get / set a flag indicating wether entry name and comment text are encoded in unicode UTF8.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.CryptoCheckValue
member.summary: Value used during password checking for PKZIP 2.0 / 'classic' encryption.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.Flags
member.summary: Get/Set general purpose bit flag for entry
member.remarks:
General purpose bit flag
Bit 0: If set, indicates the file is encrypted
Bit 1-2 Only used for compression type 6 Imploding, and 8, 9 deflating
Imploding:
Bit 1 if set indicates an 8K sliding dictionary was used. If clear a 4k dictionary was used
Bit 2 if set indicates 3 Shannon-Fanno trees were used to encode the sliding dictionary, 2 otherwise
Deflating:
Bit 2 Bit 1
0 0 Normal compression was used
0 1 Maximum compression was used
1 0 Fast compression was used
1 1 Super fast compression was used
Bit 3: If set, the fields crc-32, compressed size and uncompressed size are were not able to be written during zip file creation The correct values are held in a data descriptor immediately following the compressed data.
Bit 4: Reserved for use by PKZIP for enhanced deflating
Bit 5: If set indicates the file contains compressed patch data
Bit 6: If set indicates strong encryption was used.
Bit 7-10: Unused or reserved
Bit 11: If set the name and comments for this entry are in unicode.
Bit 12-15: Unused or reserved

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.ZipFileIndex
member.summary: Get/Set index of this entry in Zip file
member.remarks: This is only valid when the entry is part of a

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.Offset
member.summary: Get/set offset for use in central header

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.ExternalFileAttributes
member.summary: Get/Set external file attributes as an integer. The values of this are operating system dependant see HostSystem for details

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.VersionMadeBy
member.summary: Get the version made by for this entry or zero if unknown. The value / 10 indicates the major version number, and the value mod 10 is the minor version number

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.IsDOSEntry
member.summary: Get a value indicating this entry is for a DOS/Windows system.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.HostSystem
member.summary: Gets the compatability information for the external file attribute If the external file attributes are compatible with MS-DOS and can be read by PKZIP for DOS version 2.04g then this value will be zero. Otherwise the value will be non-zero and identify the host system on which the attributes are compatible.
member.remarks:
The values for this as defined in the Zip File format and by others are shown below. The values are somewhat misleading in some cases as they are not all used as shown. You should consult the relevant documentation to obtain up to date and correct information. The modified appnote by the infozip group is particularly helpful as it documents a lot of peculiarities. The document is however a little dated.
0 - MS-DOS and OS/2 (FAT / VFAT / FAT32 file systems)
1 - Amiga
2 - OpenVMS
3 - Unix
4 - VM/CMS
5 - Atari ST
6 - OS/2 HPFS
7 - Macintosh
8 - Z-System
9 - CP/M
10 - Windows NTFS
11 - MVS (OS/390 - Z/OS)
12 - VSE
13 - Acorn Risc
14 - VFAT
15 - Alternate MVS
16 - BeOS
17 - Tandem
18 - OS/400
19 - OS/X (Darwin)
99 - WinZip AES
remainder - unused

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.Version
member.summary: Get minimum Zip feature version required to extract this entry
member.remarks:
Minimum features are defined as:
1.0 - Default value
1.1 - File is a volume label
2.0 - File is a folder/directory
2.0 - File is compressed using Deflate compression
2.0 - File is encrypted using traditional encryption
2.1 - File is compressed using Deflate64
2.5 - File is compressed using PKWARE DCL Implode
2.7 - File is a patch data set
4.5 - File uses Zip64 format extensions
4.6 - File is compressed using BZIP2 compression
5.0 - File is encrypted using DES
5.0 - File is encrypted using 3DES
5.0 - File is encrypted using original RC2 encryption
5.0 - File is encrypted using RC4 encryption
5.1 - File is encrypted using AES encryption
5.1 - File is encrypted using corrected RC2 encryption
5.1 - File is encrypted using corrected RC2-64 encryption
6.1 - File is encrypted using non-OAEP key wrapping
6.2 - Central directory encryption (not confirmed yet)
6.3 - File is compressed using LZMA
6.3 - File is compressed using PPMD+
6.3 - File is encrypted using Blowfish
6.3 - File is encrypted using Twofish

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.IsDirectory

member.summary: Static constructor.

member.summary: Transform a windows directory name according to the Zip file naming conventions.
member.returns: The transformed name.

member.summary: Transform a windows file name according to the Zip file naming conventions.
member.returns: The transformed name.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipNameTransform.MakeValidName(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Force a name to be valid by replacing invalid characters with a fixed value
member.returns: Returns a valid name

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipNameTransform.IsValidName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Test a name to see if it is a valid name for a zip entry.
member.param: If true checking is relaxed about windows file names and absolute paths.
member.returns: Returns true if the name is a valid zip name; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Zip path names are actually in Unix format, and should only contain relative paths. This means that any path stored should not contain a drive or device letter, or a leading slash. All slashes should forward slashes '/'. An empty name is valid for a file where the input comes from standard input. A null name is not considered valid.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipNameTransform.IsValidName(System.String)
member.summary: Test a name to see if it is a valid name for a zip entry.
member.returns: Returns true if the name is a valid zip name; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Zip path names are actually in unix format, and should only contain relative paths if a path is present. This means that the path stored should not contain a drive or device letter, or a leading slash. All slashes should forward slashes '/'. An empty name is valid where the input comes from standard input. A null name is not considered valid.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipNameTransform.TrimPrefix

member.remarks: The prefix is trimmed before any conversion from a windows path is done.

member.name: M:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.GDIApi.GetDeviceCaps(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves device-specific information for the specified device.
member.param: Specifies the item to return. This parameter can be one of the DeviceCap enum
member.returns: The return value specifies the value of the desired item.

member.name: M:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.GDIApi.GetDC(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to a display device context (DC) for the client area of a specified window or for the entire screen.
member.param: Handle to the window whose DC is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, GetDC retrieves the DC for the entire screen.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the DC for the specified window's client area. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.GDIApi.ExtTextOut(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,CADImport.RECT@,System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Draws text using the currently selected font, background color, and text color. You can optionally provide dimensions to be used for clipping, opaquing, or both.
member.param: A handle to the device context.
Specifies the x-coordinate, in logical coordinates, of the reference point used to position the string.
Specifies the y-coordinate, in logical coordinates, of the reference point used to position the string.
Specifies how to use the application-defined rectangle.
Pointer to an optional RECT structure that specifies the dimensions, in logical coordinates, of a rectangle that is used for clipping, opaquing, or both.
Pointer to a string that specifies the text to be drawn. The string does not need to be zero-terminated, since cbCount specifies the length of the string.
Specifies the length of the string. For the ANSI function it is a BYTE count and for the Unicode function it is a WORD count.
Pointer to an optional array of values that indicate the distance between origins of adjacent character cells.
member.returns: If the string is drawn, the return value is nonzero; otherwize the return value is zero.

member.name: M:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.GDIApi.ExtTextOutW(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,CADImport.RECT@,System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: ExtTextOutW is a version of the ExtTextOut function supported by the Microsoft Layer for Unicode. To use this, you must add certain files to your application, as outlined in Microsoft Layer for Unicode on Windows 95/98/Me Systems.

member.name: T:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap
member.summary: Device-specific information.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.DRIVERVERSION
member.summary: The device driver version.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.TECHNOLOGY
member.summary: Device technology.

p.b: Device tehnology can be any one of the following values:

remarks.p: DT_PLOTTER - Vector plotter
DT_RASDISPLAY - Raster display
DT_RASPRINTER - Raster printer
DT_RASCAMERA - Raster camera
DT_CHARSTREAM - Character stream
DT_METAFILE - Metafile
DT_DISPFILE - Display file

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.HORZSIZE
member.summary: Width, in millimeters, of the physical screen.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.VERTSIZE
member.summary: Height, in millimeters, of the physical screen.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.HORZRES
member.summary: Width, in pixels, of the screen.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.VERTRES
member.summary: Height, in raster lines, of the screen.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.BITSPIXEL
member.summary: Number of adjacent color bits for each pixel.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.PLANES
member.summary: Number of color planes.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.NUMBRUSHES
member.summary: Number of device-specific brushes.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.NUMPENS
member.summary: Number of device-specific pens.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.NUMMARKERS
member.summary: Number of device-specific markers.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.NUMFONTS
member.summary: Number of device-specific fonts.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.NUMCOLORS
member.summary: Number of entries in the device's color table.
member.remarks: For the device that has a color depth of no more than 8 bits per pixel. For devices with greater color depths, 1 is returned.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.PDEVICESIZE
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.CURVECAPS
member.summary: Value that indicates the curve capabilities of the device.

p.b: Curve capabilities are shown in the following table:

remarks.p: CC_NONE - Device does not support curves.
CC_CHORD - Device can draw chord arcs.
CC_CIRCLES - Device can draw circles.
CC_ELLIPSES - Device can draw ellipses.
CC_INTERIORS - Device can draw interiors.
CC_PIE - Device can draw pie wedges.
CC_ROUNDRECT - Device can draw rounded rectangles.
CC_STYLED - Device can draw styled borders.
CC_WIDE - Device can draw wide borders.
CC_WIDESTYLED - Device can draw borders that are wide and styled.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.LINECAPS
member.summary: Value that indicates the line capabilities of the device.

p.b: Line capabilities are shown in the following table:

remarks.p: LC_NONE - Device does not support lines.
LC_MARKER - Device can draw a marker.
LC_POLYLINE - Device can draw a polyline.
LC_POLYMARKER - Device can draw multiple markers.
LC_INTERIORS - Device can draw interiors.
LC_STYLED - Device can draw styled lines.
LC_WIDE - Device can draw wide lines.
LC_WIDESTYLED - Device can draw lines that are wide and styled.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.POLYGONALCAPS
member.summary: Value that indicates the polygon capabilities of the device.

p.b: Polygon capabilities are shown in the following table:

remarks.p: PC_NONE - Device does not support polygons.
PC_POLYGONE - Device can draw alternate-fill polygons.
PC_RECTANGLE - Device can draw rectangles.
PC_SCANLINE - Device can draw a single scanline.
PC_INTERIORS - Device can draw interiors.
PC_STYLED - Device can draw styled borders.
PC_WIDE - Device can draw wide borders.
PC_WIDESTYLED - Device can draw borders that are wide and styled.
PC_WINDPOLYGON - Device can draw winding-fill polygons.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.TEXTCAPS
member.summary: Value that indicates the text capabilities of the device.

p.b: Text capabilities are shown in the following table:

remarks.p: TC_OP_CHARACTER - Device is capable of character output precision.
TC_OP_STROKE - Device is capable of stroke output precision.
TC_CP_STROKE - Device is capable of stroke clip precision.
TC_CR_90 - Device is capable of 90-degree character rotation.
TC_CR_ANY - Device is capable of any character rotation.
TC_SF_X_YINDEP - Device can scale independently in the x- and y-directions.
TC_SA_DOUBLE - Device is capable of doubled character for scaling.
TC_SA_INTEGER - Device uses integer multiples only for character scaling.
TC_SA_CONTIN - Device uses any multiples for exact character scaling.
TC_EA_DOUBLE - Device can draw double-weight characters.
TC_IA_ABLE - Device can italicize.
TC_UA_ABLE - Device can underline.
TC_SO_ABLE - Device can draw strikeouts.
TC_RA_ABLE - Device can draw raster fonts.
TC_VA_ABLE - Device can draw vector fonts.
TC_RESERVED - Reserved; must be zero.
TC_SCROLLBLT - Device cannot scroll using a bit-block transfer. Note that this meaning may be the opposite of what you expect.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.CLIPCAPS
member.summary: Flag that indicates the clipping capabilities of the device.
member.value: If the device can clip to a rectangle, it is 1. Otherwise, it is 0.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.RASTERCAPS
member.summary: Value that indicates the raster capabilities of the device.

p.b: Raster capabilities are shown in the following table:

remarks.p: RC_BANDING - Requires banding support.
RC_BITBLT - Capable of transferring bitmaps.
RC_BITMAP64 - Capable of supporting bitmaps larger than 64 KB.
RC_DI_BITMAP - Capable of supporting the SetDIBits and GetDIBits functions.
RC_DIBTODEV - Capable of supporting the SetDIBitsToDevice function.
RC_FLOODFILL - Capable of performing flood fills.
RC_PALETTE - Specifies a palette-based device.
RC_SCALING - Capable of scaling.
RC_STRETCHBLT - Capable of performing the StretchBlt function.
RC_STRETCHDIB - Capable of performing the StretchDIBits function.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.ASPECTX
member.summary: Relative width of a device pixel used for line drawing.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.ASPECTY
member.summary: Relative height of a device pixel used for line drawing.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.ASPECTXY
member.summary: Diagonal width of the device pixel used for line drawing.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.LOGPIXELSX
member.summary: Number of pixels per logical inch along the screen width.
member.remarks: In a system with multiple display monitors, this value is the same for all monitors.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.LOGPIXELSY
member.summary: Number of pixels per logical inch along the screen height.
member.remarks: In a system with multiple display monitors, this value is the same for all monitors.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.SIZEPALETTE
member.summary: Number of entries in the system palette.
member.remarks: This index is valid only if the device driver sets the RC_PALETTE bit in the RASTERCAPS index and is available only if the driver is compatible with 16-bit Windows.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.NUMRESERVED
member.summary: Number of reserved entries in the system palette.
member.remarks: This index is valid only if the device driver sets the RC_PALETTE bit in the RASTERCAPS index and is available only if the driver is compatible with 16-bit Windows.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.COLORRES
member.summary: Actual color resolution of the device, in bits per pixel.
member.remarks: This index is valid only if the device driver sets the RC_PALETTE bit in the RASTERCAPS index and is available only if the driver is compatible with 16-bit Windows.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.PHYSICALWIDTH
member.summary: For printing devices: the width of the physical page, in device units. For example, a printer set to print at 600 dpi on 8.5-x11-inch paper has a physical width value of 5100 device units.
member.remarks: Note that the physical page is almost always greater than the printable area of the page, and never smaller.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.PHYSICALHEIGHT
member.summary: For printing devices: the height of the physical page, in device units. For example, a printer set to print at 600 dpi on 8.5-by-11-inch paper has a physical height value of 6600 device units.
member.remarks: Note that the physical page is almost always greater than the printable area of the page, and never smaller.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.PHYSICALOFFSETX
member.summary: For printing devices: the distance from the left edge of the physical page to the left edge of the printable area, in device units. For example, a printer set to print at 600 dpi on 8.5-by-11-inch paper, that cannot print on the leftmost 0.25-inch of paper, has a horizontal physical offset of 150 device units.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.PHYSICALOFFSETY
member.summary: For printing devices: the distance from the top edge of the physical page to the top edge of the printable area, in device units. For example, a printer set to print at 600 dpi on 8.5-by-11-inch paper, that cannot print on the topmost 0.5-inch of paper, has a vertical physical offset of 300 device units.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.SCALINGFACTORX
member.summary: Scaling factor for the x-axis of the printer.

member.name: F:CADImport.Extensions.WinApiModule.DeviceCap.SCALINGFACTORY
member.summary: Scaling factor for the y-axis of the printer.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Adler32
member.summary:
Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Adler32.BASE
member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.remarks: The standard Unix time is a signed integer data type, directly encoding the Unix time number, which is the number of seconds since 1970-01-01. Being 32 bits means the values here cover a range of about 136 years. The minimum representable time is 1901-12-13 20:45:52, and the maximum representable time is 2038-01-19 03:14:07.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipExtraData
member.summary: A class to handle the extra data field for Zip entries
member.remarks: Extra data contains 0 or more values each prefixed by a header tag and length. They contain zero or more bytes of actual data. The data is held internally using a copy on write strategy. This is more efficient but means that for extra data created by passing in data can have the values modified by the caller in some circumstances.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator
member.summary:
This class allows us to retrieve a specified number of bits from the input buffer, as well as copy big byte blocks.
It uses an int buffer to store up to 31 bits for direct manipulation. This guarantees that we can get at least 16 bits, but we only need at most 15, so this is all safe.
There are some optimizations in this class, for example, you must never peek more than 8 bits more than needed, and you must first peek bits before you may drop them. This is not a general purpose class but optimized for the behaviour of the Inflater.
authors of the original java version : John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default StreamManipulator with all buffers empty

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.PeekBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the next sequence of bits but don't increase input pointer. bitCount must be less or equal 16 and if this call succeeds, you must drop at least n - 8 bits in the next call.
member.param: The number of bits to peek.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available. */

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.DropBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Drops the next n bits from the input. You should have called PeekBits with a bigger or equal n before, to make sure that enough bits are in the bit buffer.
member.param: The number of bits to drop.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.GetBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next n bits and increases input pointer. This is equivalent to followed by , except for correct error handling.
member.param: The number of bits to retrieve.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.SkipToByteBoundary
member.summary: Skips to the next byte boundary.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.CopyBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies bytes from input buffer to output buffer starting at output[offset]. You have to make sure, that the buffer is byte aligned. If not enough bytes are available, copies fewer bytes.
member.param: The buffer to copy bytes to.
The offset in the buffer at which copying starts
The length to copy, 0 is allowed.
member.returns: The number of bytes copied, 0 if no bytes were available.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.Reset
member.summary: Resets state and empties internal buffers

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add more input for consumption. Only call when IsNeedingInput returns true
member.param: offset of first byte of input
number of bytes of input to add.

member.summary: Gets the number of bits available in the bit buffer. This must be only called when a previous PeekBits() returned -1.
member.returns: the number of bits available.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.AvailableBytes
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes available.
member.returns: The number of bytes available.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.FastZip.UseZip64
member.summary: Gets or sets the setting for Zip64 handling when writing.
member.remarks: The default value is dynamic which is not backwards compatible with old programs and can cause problems with XP's built in compression which cant read Zip64 archives. However it does avoid the situation were a large file is added and cannot be completed correctly. NOTE: Setting the size for entries before they are added is the best solution! By default the EntryFactory used by FastZip will set fhe file size.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Core.NameFilter
member.summary: NameFilter is a string matching class which allows for both positive and negative matching. A filter is a sequence of independant regular expressions separated by semi-colons ';'. To include a semi-colon it may be quoted as in \;. Each expression can be prefixed by a plus '+' sign or a minus '-' sign to denote the expression is intended to include or exclude names. If neither a plus or minus sign is found include is the default. A given name is tested for inclusion before checking exclusions. Only names matching an include spec and not matching an exclude spec are deemed to match the filter. An empty filter matches any name.
member.example: The following expression includes all name ending in '.dat' with the exception of 'dummy.dat' "+\.dat$;-^dummy\.dat$"
